paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on genetic variants in the KCNH2 gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In one study of patients prescribed beta-blocker therapy over an average of 5 years, cardiac event rates also differed according to subtype.
The frequency of clinical events prior to initiation of beta-blocker therapy from birth to 40 years of age was significantly higher in LQT2.
Silent gene carriers (ie, normal QTc at rest) constitute 19% with LQT2.
The prognosis of LQTS is also related to the underlying genetic abnormality.

functional_data.summary: Loss-of-function mutations in KCNH2 lead to reduced IKr and delayed cardiac repolarization.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, variants segregate with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: Variants in KCNH2 are associated with a higher risk of arrhythmia.
key_quotes: Mutations in the pore region of this channel are more likely to be associated with cardiac events and sudden death.
Loss-of-function mutations result in a reduced IKr and delayed cardiac repolarization manifesting as a prolonged QT interval on ECG.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text.
